▪ During the summer there wasn’t enough rain, but now we have the opposite problem.

▪ Getting angry with him didn’t work, so I tried the opposite approach.
Bắt đàu giận dữ với anh ta vì đã không làm việc, vì vây tôi thử cái cách tiếp cận ngược lại
the opposite result/effect/conclusion etc; kết quả /ảnh hưởng/kết luận ngược lai

children.name: opposite
children.definition: be s if two people or things are opposites, they are as different as possible from each other: trái ngược
examples: ▪ Although the sweet and sour flavours are opposites, they combine very well in this oriental dish.

children.name: be complete opposites
examples: ▪ In both looks and personality the girls were complete opposites.

children.name: be opposites in
examples: ▪ We were alike in interests and tastes, but we were opposites in temperament.

children.name: reverse
children.definition: opposite to what is usual or to what has just been stated: trái ngược , ngược lại
examples: ▪ In some families the father goes out to work and the mother stays at home. In others, the reverse situation is true.
▪ His advice had the reverse effect to that intended.

children.name: antithesis
children.definition: be the  of formal to be completely opposite in quality or character to sth: tương phản, đối chọi, đối lập
examples: Love is the antithesis of selfishness.
His policies are the antitheses of all that makes us a decent, tolerant society.

children.name: sb/sth that is completely different from sb/sth else
other way around
children.definition: the  the opposite of what you thought or of what sb has just said: trái ngược
examples: No, the street was named after the college, not the other way around the college was not named after the street.
I thought he was the boss and she was his secretary, but in fact it was the other way around.

children.name: opposite
children.definition: the   sự trái ngược, ngược lại
examples: ▪ Our first baby hardly ever cried in the night, but our second is the opposite - we never get any sleep.
Đứa con đâu tiên của chúng ta khóc vao buổi tối nhưng dứa thứ hai thì ngược lai- chúng tôi không thể ngủ được
the opposite of sự trai ngược
▪ ‘Light’ is the opposite of both ‘dark’ and ‘heavy’.
Từ light thì trái ngược với hai rừ " dark" và " heavey"
do the opposite: làm ngược lại
▪ They asked for our advice and then did the opposite!
họ hỏi tôi để xin lời khuyên va tôi thì làm ngược lại
exactly/just the opposite thất sự trái ngược

Tôi nghĩ cô áy sẽ buồn là do các tin tức tuy nhiên sự phản ứng của cô ấy hoàn toàn ngược lại

children.name: reverse
children.definition: the   formal the exact opposite of the situation, idea, process that has just been mentioned: diều trái ngược
examples: ▪ The acid must be added to the water -- doing the reverse can be highly dangerous.
Axit cần phải được thêm vào nước - làm ngược lai thì sẽ rât nguy hiểm
▪ The economic situation is certainly improving, although widespread unemployment suggests the reverse.
Tình hình thế giới đang cải thiện một cách chắc chắn, măc dù thất nghiệp thì ngược lại
the reverse of: điều trái ngược

anh ấy nói rắng những người nổi loạn bị giết một cách cố ý, còn chuyện xảy ra thì ngược lại

children.name: vice versa
children.definition: used to talk about the opposite of a situation that you have just mentioned: ngược lại
examples: Whenever I’m at home, my husband seems to be out, and vice versa when I am out, he’s at home !
Astronomers were still uncertain whether the Earth travelled around the Sun or vice-versa.
Dutch speakers can usually understand German quite well, but not vice versa.

children.name: opposite extreme
children.definition: go to the / go from one extreme to the other to stop doing one thing far too much, but then start doing the opposite far too much: từ thái cực này đến thái cực khác
examples: She used to eat too much, but now she’s gone to the opposite extreme and is practically starving herself.
Doug’s gone from one extreme to the other - it used to be impossible to drag him away from the TV. Now we can’t get him to stay home.

children.name: opposite
examples: ▪ We’re good friends, but we have opposite views when it comes to politics.
▪ It is strange how two scientists studying the same problem can come to completely opposite conclusions.
▪ Margaret has very strong opinions, but she always tries to understand the opposite point of view.

children.name: opposing
children.definition: opposing opinions, beliefs, statements etc are the opposite of each other: trái ngược
examples: ▪ Bobbie and Jo have opposing views on marriage.
▪ Brad was prepared to accept that opposing beliefs could be held equally strongly and passionately.
▪ The Party seems to be unsure which of two opposing political philosophies to follow.

children.name: opposed
children.definition: diametrically    completely opposite to and completely disagreeing with each other: :hoàn toàn trái ngược
examples: ▪ He feels that his Christian beliefs and the principles of capitalism are diametrically opposed.

children.name: on the contrary
children.definition: use this to tell sb that the opposite of what they say is true: ngược lại
examples: ‘Do you think the divorce will upset her family?’ ‘On the contrary. It will probably come as a relief.’
‘You probably aren’t interested in my opinion.’ ‘On the contrary, any ideas you have to add would be very welcome.’

children.name: opposite
children.definition: just the /reverseC2 alsoquite the opposite/reverseC2 especially UK, spoken  use this to tell someone that the opposite of a situation or statement is true: ngược lại
examples: My friends say I spend too much time studying, but my parents say just the opposite.
We were not in love at the time - quite the opposite in fact.
